channel.title: Meta on d.kens
channel.description: Recent content in Meta on d.kens

item.title: Racket, Pollen and Fossilâ€¦ oh my!
item.description: A tale of me discovering, learning and playing with a new set of toys for my blog… Racket Here is where it all started. A new programming language and some youtube videos led me to my first step on this journey. Emacs Lisp is the programming language underlying Emacs. I discovered Racket after exploring all the Lispy type languages available today. The Racket documentation impresses me and that led me to Scribble, the module inside Racket for writing (primarily) documentation.

item.title: Anatomy of a Blog
item.description: Originally published on 25-06-2019 updated: switched from using Netlify to Github.io Blogs are a thing… again. I’ve tried doing them over the years with little success. I think it’s because I found it more interesting to fiddle with the blog back-end rather than the actual blog itself. This time it’s different! (I hope) This is how my words get to the site: In EMACS I open my blog file called “all-posts.

item.title: The Case for EMACS
item.description: I use a mac. I use EMACS. I use a bunch of other apps too; even other word processors and text editors. But I gravitate towards EMACS when I’m on my main computer. It has become my primary tool for many things that normally have a flagship app. For example, I’ve tried the venerable OmniFocus and Things apps for to-do lists and projects. Now I use org-mode in EMACS. I’ve got Day One as a journaling app but now I use org-mode.

item.title: Why the name "Dave 2.1"?
item.description: Dave 0.5 was me in school. Kindergarten through College. Mostly Northern Virginia. Finished at the University of Virginia with a BS in Aerospace Engineering. Dave 1.0 was my first profession. 20 years as a US Air Force Officer, fighter-pilot, instructor. Saw the world. Been there, done that. Dave 2.0 was my second professional life. Family, tech industry, then IT support and professional services. Mostly family. Wife, three kids and a dog.
